Pop-Up Tea Library
Grab a warm mug of tea and hunker down for your late-night studying.
May 13, 15, 16, 17, and 18, 6:00 p.m. - 10:00 p.m.





 
   





 


Papers, Problems, and PJ's
Finish Spring 2023 strong and get free drop-in tutoring brought to you by MESA, LARC, and the University Library.





 
   





 


Pet a Pup
Take a "paws" from your studying to relax with a friendly, cuddly therapy dog.
May 17, 10:00 a.m. - 2:30 p.m.





 
 


Previous Next 












In the Gallery






Color: A Collective View
The Sonoma State University Library is showing Color: A Collective View from December 5, 2022 to July 15, 2023.
Please join us in celebrating this selection of remarkable materials at the gallery reception on Thursday, December 8, 2022 from 4:00 - 5:30 PM.

    Common Read  






 








The Heart of Whiteness




Julian B. Carter


   








Manliness and Civilization: A Cultural History of Gender and Race in the United States




Gail Bederman


   








The Racial Contract




Charles W. Mills


   








The Routledge Handbook of the History of Settler Colonialism




Edward Cavanaugh


   








Represent and Destroy




Jodi Melamed


   








Racial Propositions




Daniel Martinez HoSang


   








White By Law




Ian Haney Lopez


   








Race, Whiteness, and Education




Zeus Leonardo


   








So You Want to Talk About Race




Ijeoma Oluo


   








Race in the Schoolyard




Amanda Lewis


   








Playing in the Dark: Whiteness in the Literary Imagination




Toni Morrison


   








White Reign: Deploying Whiteness in America




Joe L. Kincheloe, ed. 


   








The Possessive Investment in Whiteness




George Lipsitz


   








White Women, Race Matters




Ruth Frankenberg


   








Darkwater: Voices from Within the Veil




W.E.B. DuBois


   








Red Skin, White Masks




Glen Sean Coulthard


   








Black Skin, White Masks




Frantz Fanon


   








Critical Diversity Literacy




Melissa Steyn


   








The Colonizer and the Colonized




Albert Memmi


   








Settler Colonialism




Sai Englert


   








The Fire Next Time




James Baldwin


   








Not a Nation of Immigrants




Roxanne Dunbar-Ortiz


   








White Over Black




Winthrop D. Jordan 


   








Speaking of Indigenous Politics




J. Kehaulani Kauanui


   








The Wages of Whiteness




David Roediger


   








Native Space




Natchee Blu Barnd


   








The Rise and Fall of the White Republic




Alexander Saxton


   








Racial Ecologies




Leilani Nishimi and Kim Hester Williams, eds.
